title: Six registered political parties receive show-cause notices from Chennai district election office

title: Ukraine counts on India’s contribution to ending war with Russia: Zelenskyy
content: “Now, as the entire world strives to end this horrible war with dignity and lasting peace, we count on India’s contribution,” Mr. Zelenskyy said

title: West Bengal colleges face admission crisis as student numbers plummet
content: Delayed centralised portal and legal disputes over OBC list leave many undergraduate seats vacant, with students increasingly choosing other States

content: The searches were carried out in and around Delhi under the PMLA, based on a case registered in June 2025 by Delhi’s Anti-Corruption Branch against former Delhi Health Ministers, private contractors and unknown government servants

title: U.S. gets ready to impose additional tariffs on India from August 27, issues official notification
content: “The duties set out in the Annex to this document are effective with respect to products of India that are entered for consumption, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after 12:01 a.m. eastern daylight time on August 27, 2025,” the DHS notification said

title: Bhagwat to outline RSS’ vision for future India at 3-day lecture series from today
content: The lecture series, part of RSS’s outreach programme for its centenary year, is expected to be attended by around 1,300 people.

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE:  Constitution does not define deemed assent, says Goa counsel
content: Centre had concluded its arguments by strongly advocating against imposing timelines on constitutional authorities like President and Governors; says the issue was better addressed in the political sphere than in the court

title: Over 1,000 women entrepreneurs from SHGs to be trained in capacity building
content: The programme aims to cover 100 Mahila Shakti Canteens; the training will be focused on financial and digital literacy, sales, marketing and retail management

content: What has the World Health Organization said about Real Money Games? How are e-sports and social gaming segments different from online money games? What are the penalties laid out in the Act with respect to engaging with online money games? Has the Supreme Court intervened?

title: Traffic diversions for Khairatabad Bada Ganesh darshan
content: Congestion can be expected at Khairatabad, Shadan College, Nirankari, Old PS Saifabad, Mint Compound and Necklace Rotary from August 27 to September 6

title: Content creator Atharva Sudame deletes video on social harmony after backlash
content: Mr. Sudame’s reel evoked mixed responses on social media as some spoke in favour of it while some others opposed it strongly, telling him to not give any advice on religious matters

title: ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur’ scheme empowers 1,000 women to take the driver’s seat in A.P.
content: MEPMA joined hands with Rapido in March to provide electric two-wheelers and three-wheelers to SHG women and their families

title: IIT Bombay researchers use microbes to unlock nature’s hidden rules
content: Subtle changes in food lead to divergent evolutionary paths, offering clues to predict future adaptations

title: Masked Man, A Skull, Mass Grave Claim: Decoding The Dharmasthala Conspiracy
content: A masked man, skull in hand, walked into a police station in Karnataka's temple town, Dharmasthala, on July 3 and made chilling allegations about a mass grave where hundreds of women, many of them victims of sexual assault, were buried.

title: FBI Hunts For Ex-Soldier Travis Decker, Wanted In Deaths Of 3 Daughters
content: The FBI on Monday launched an intensive two-day search for clues to the whereabouts of Travis Decker near the Washington state campground where his three young daughters were found dead in early June.

title: 'Empty Offices, Lost Orders': India's Diamond Hub In Crisis As US Tariffs Threaten Exports
content: The Surat Diamond Bourse, billed as the world's largest office complex - surpassing even the Pentagon in size and symbolising India's growing trade ambitions, stands eerily quiet, with only a few traders at work.

title: Election Commission Seeks Public Opinion On 5 Questions Amid Bihar Poll Row Revision
content: The Election Commission of India on Tuesday sought public opinion on various concerns regarding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, which ignited a full-scale spat between the ruling and Opposition parties in Bihar, sources said.

title: What Is A Digital Services Tax That Can Increase Trump Tariffs
content: A Digital Services Tax (DST) is a levy on the revenue that large digital companies earn from users in a country, even if the company has no physical office there.

title: Over 170 Villages Flooded In Odisha, Weather Office Warns Of Heavy Rain From Bay Of Bengal
content: More than 170 villages in Balasore, Bhadrak and Jajpur districts of North Odisha were under flood water for the second consecutive day on Tuesday, even as the IMD has warned of heavy rainfall in the next few days

title: 5 Cops Injured In Bengal During Clash With Mob Over Kangaroo Court
content: In West Bengal's Malda, when cops went to rescue a man, accused of harassing a woman who had gone for cattle grazing, they were allegedly attacked with sticks and stones.

title: After Anurag Thakur's 'Hanuman In Space' Remark, BJP Leader's '1st Plane' Claim
content: Days after BJP leader Anurag Thakur told school students that Lord Hanuman might have been the first space traveller, his colleague Shivraj Chouhan has claimed that India had flying machines long before the Wright brothers invented the aeroplane.

title: Tripura Woman Tied, Beaten Up, Hair Cut. Reason: Quarrel With Mother-In-Law
content: In a shocking case of mob violence, a woman in Tripura's Gomati district was tied to a pole, thrashed, and her hair cut after neighbours attacked her for allegedly quarreling with her mother-in-law

title: Dowry Victim Nikki Had Caught Husband's Affair. He Then Assaulted 'Lover'
content: The brutal murder of 26-year-old Nikki Bhati, burnt alive in her matrimonial home in Noida allegedly over dowry demands, has reopened a window into her husband's violent past.

title: Defence Chief Highlights Sudarshan Chakra As India's Version Of Israel's Iron Dome
content: The 'Sudarshan Chakra' air defence system will entail development of a robust infrastructure comprising a range of key tri-services military assets such as missiles and surveillance systems

title: "Sounds Stronger": Inside Trump's Plan To Bring Back "Department Of War"
content: US President Donald Trump reiterated his intentions of renaming the Department of Defence as the "Department of War", which, according to him, "sounds stronger."

title: Influencer's Reel At Guruvayur Temple Triggers Storm, 'Purification' Drive
content: A viral Instagram reel by influencer and former Bigg Boss Malayalam contestant Jasmin Jaffar has triggered a major controversy at Kerala's Guruvayur Sree Krishna Temple, prompting temple authorities to initiate a six-day purification ritual.

title: Man Slits Wife's Throat, Sets Body On Fire. He Planned Murder For A Month
content: A man has been arrested in Telangana's Mahbubnagar and remanded to judicial custody for the brutal murder of his wife, whom he allegedly killed by slitting her throat and setting her ablaze, all stemming from his suspicion of her infidelity.

title: The Oldest Person To Climb Mount Fuji Is A 102-Year-Old Japanese Man
content: A 102-year-old Japanese man with a serious heart condition has been certified as the oldest person to climb Mount Fuji -- but still shrugged off the feat as nothing special.

title: Supreme Court Overturns Own Death Penalty Order For Rape-Murder Convict
content: The Supreme Court has said that it can revisit its own verdict of a death sentence if it is convinced that the accused has been condemned to the death penalty without ensuring that the guidelines mandated by the top court were followed.

title: Japan Post Suspends Small Parcel Deliveries To US Due To Trump Tariffs
content: Japan Post Co will suspend shipping of some small packages to the United States due to fresh tariffs imposed by the US government, in a sign of how President Donald Trump's tariffs may impact smaller businesses and individuals.

title: Tripura Man Gets Life Term For Raping Minor, Girl's Mother, Sister Jailed For Aiding Crime
content: A POCSO court in North Tripura has sentenced a 27-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping a minor girl on multiple occasions.

title: Congress Leader Jeetu Patwari's Wild Claim Over Women Drinking Alcohol And A Fact-Check
content: Madhya Pradesh Congress president Jeetu Patwari has triggered a political storm with his controversial claim that women in Madhya Pradesh consume more alcohol than anywhere else in the country.

title: How China Decides Who Will Win Elections In New York City
content: Community groups with close ties to Beijing have been working behind the scenes in New York City to influence who gets elected and who does not, according to a report in a leading US daily.

title: North Odisha faces flood situation due to incessant rain
content: A fresh low pressure area has formed over Bay of Bengal which will trigger rain till August 29, says IMD

title: Like bronze idols, India’s dino egg fossils risk being sold abroad
content: Around the world, fossils once bound for labs are now advertised in storefronts and auction houses. Ammonites, extinct sea creatures with coiled shells, once crowded ancient oceans. Today, their fossilised remains are sold on the streets of Paris. Larger, rarer specimens fetch staggering sums at auctions from private collectors

title: Police oppose Chennai conservancy workers’ plea to protest indefinitely
content: Say, the workers had lost a case against outsourcing of conservancy work and so they cannot indulge in protests instead of working out further legal remedy

title: Rajasthan High Court stays order on panchayat elections
content: A Single Judge Bench had on August 18 ordered the State government to conduct the panchayat polls soon, after which the State Election Commission stated that it would shortly announce the dates

title: Calcutta High Court directs CID to investigate unnatural deaths at Purba Medinipur’s Khejuri, notes differences in autopsies
content: After two persons were found dead at Muharram event site this year, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari had claimed that they were lynched for communal reasons, while the Trinamool Congress and the police maintained that the deaths were caused by an electrocution accident.

title: Supreme Court offers death row convict facility in jail to grieve virtually for his deceased mother

title: Technical, operational issues being resolved: SSC chief on ‘irregularities’ in recruitment exams

Udhayan, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests and Director of the institute, says this is the first study on fireflies in the State where genetic analysis was undertaken

content: We're following releases, trades, signings and other intriguing moves for all 32 NFL teams before the 4 p.m. ET roster cut-down deadline on Tuesday.

content: Cal Raleigh hit his 50th homer, extending his major league record for a catcher and joining Mickey Mantle as the only switch-hitters to reach that mark.

title: Cards' Contreras ejected, hits own coach with bat
content: Following a called third strike in the seventh inning Monday, first baseman Willson Contreras threw a bat that mistakenly hit his own coach and tossed gum on the field after he was ejected in the St. Louis Cardinals' 7-6 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Bengals give star DE Hendrickson big pay bump

content: Free agent wide receiver Amari Cooper is returning to the Raiders on a one-year contract, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: ‘Strategic shock’: Trump’s tariffs to hit 66% of India’s exports to US; China, Vietnam set to gain
content: Starting August 27, 2025, the US will impose 50% tariffs on $60.2 billion worth of Indian exports, impacting textiles, gems, and furniture. This move is projected to significantly reduce India's exports to the US, potentially benefiting countries like China and Vietnam.

title: 'Tried to pull BJP's leg': DKS 'apologises' after RSS anthem row; backs Gandhi family
content: DK Shivakumar apologized on Tuesday for reciting the RSS anthem in the Karnataka Assembly, sparking controversy. Khan stated his remarks were intended to tease the BJP and expressed regret if anyone was hurt.

title: Greater Noida dowry murder: Father of Nikki makes shocking 'signboard' claim
content: Nikki Bhati's father is demanding the demolition of her in-laws' house after she was allegedly murdered for dowry in Greater Noida. He accuses the family of relentless harassment and obstructing her business aspirations, alleging his daughter was set ablaze after dowry demands went unmet. Police have arrested the husband and in-laws, while the NCW condemns the killing.

title: 'Missions to be conducted': PM Modi addresses India's rare earths shortages
content: Prime Minister Modi launched the National Critical Mineral Mission to boost domestic exploration and capacity for rare earth minerals vital for the auto industry. He flagged off Maruti Suzuki’s first BEV, the e-Vitara, for export to 100 countries, highlighting India's growing role in global EV manufacturing.

title: Heavy rains lash J&K: Landslides reported at multiple locations; Srinagar highway closed
content: A cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district triggered flash floods, disrupting normal life and closing the Jammu-Srinagar highway. Heavy rainfall caused landslides at multiple locations, halting traffic and damaging homes in Kishtwar, Doda, and Rajouri. Rivers are overflowing, and authorities have issued warnings for continued rainfall and potential hazards.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to employees: To not use AI would leave us behind
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has declared artificial intelligence as a pivotal opportunity, urging employees to integrate AI into their work. Despite a late start, Cook believes Apple can dominate the AI landscape, drawing parallels to past successes like the iPhone. The company is investing heavily, hiring 12,000 new employees and developing specialized AI infrastructure.

title: 'He's a hypocrite' - Former India cricketer lambasts Gautam Gambhir - Here's why
content: Former Indian cricketer Manoj Tiwary has strongly criticized head coach Gautam Gambhir, labeling him a "hypocrite" for India's upcoming Asia Cup match against Pakistan. Tiwary highlighted Gambhir's previous stance against playing Pakistan, questioning his current role as coach.

title: Traders bathe in potholes to protest crumbling road in Chhattisgarh - watch
content: Traders in Chhattisgarh's Korba district staged a half-naked protest, bathing in pothole-filled rainwater on the Kusmunda–Imlichapar road to highlight its appalling condition. The monsoon has transformed the road into a hazardous pond, severely disrupting business and causing frequent accidents. Frustrated by government inaction, the traders took this symbolic step to demand immediate repairs.

title: Asia Cup | SKY on his injury status - 'I knew how the recovery is going to be'
content: Suryakumar Yadav recovered from an injury sustained near the end of IPL 2025. He spent weeks at the BCCI Centre of Excellence. There, he underwent a structured rehabilitation process. Yadav praised the facility and staff for their support. He focused on mindset and physical recovery. Now, Suryakumar Yadav is fit.

title: How Google AI tool got Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’ mom’s funeral wrong
content: Google's AI Overview feature has sparked controversy after falsely reporting details of Jacklyn Gise Bezos's funeral, including fabricated celebrity attendees and a space-themed eulogy. The AI-generated summary claimed appearances by Elon Musk, Oprah Winfrey, and a performance by Eminem, all of which were untrue.

title: 'Inshallah...': Pakistan bowler warns India ahead of Asia Cup clash in UAE - Watch
content: Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf has stirred the pot ahead of the Asia Cup clash with India, confidently proclaiming victory in both anticipated matches. While Pakistan gears up for the tournament and a preceding tri-series, a surprising squad selection sees Salman Agha appointed captain, with Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan notably absent.

title: 'Obstacles to free trade': German envoy backs India on Trump tariffs
content: German envoy Georg Enzweiler criticized the US imposition of tariffs on various countries, deeming them "obstacles to free trade." He advocated for minimizing tariffs to promote open commerce.

title: Trump tariff impact: Why is stock market down today? Top 6 reasons
content: Donald Trump tariffs impact on stock market: Indian stock markets plummeted on Tuesday, with the Nifty50 and Sensex taking a hit following the US imposing 50% tariffs on Indian exports. This decision, coupled with profit booking, foreign investment outflows, and a weakening rupee, intensified negative market sentiment.

title: SpaceX prodigy exits: Kairan Quazi, hired by Elon Musk at 14, says ‘I felt ready’
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old former SpaceX engineer, is making a surprising move to Wall Street, joining Citadel Securities as a quantitative developer. He chose quant finance over AI labs due to its fast-paced environment and immediate impact. Quazi's unconventional path includes skipping grades and becoming SpaceX's youngest employee, now he's ready to tackle new challenges in the financial world.

title: Trump's tariff bomb on India: US issues notice to implement 50% 'sanctions'
content: The US has imposed a 50% tariff on most goods imported from India, citing India's indirect import of Russian oil and alleged threats to the US. This action, impacting sectors like textiles and seafood, exempts pharmaceuticals and electronics. Analysts predict a potential GDP reduction for India, although the impact is moderated by domestic consumption.

title: Syko Stu GoFundMe fundraiser crosses $50,000 following Raja Jackson wrestling attack
content: Pro wrestler Syko Stu, a U.S. Army veteran, is hospitalized after a violent, unscripted attack by Raja Jackson, son of UFC star Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, at a KnokX Pro Wrestling event in Sun Valley, California. Stu's wife, Contessa Patterson, launched a GoFundMe page to support his treatment and recovery, which has already raised over $50,000.

title: Alien spaceship or comet? NASA shares update on object racing through Solar System
content: NASA's telescopes have captured detailed observations of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS, confirming it as a natural comet rich in CO₂ and water ice. Discovered in 2025, the comet's composition and trajectory align with known processes of icy comets ejected from other star systems, debunking speculation about alien origins. Ongoing observations aim to understand its structure and activity.

title: ‘Not beautiful enough’: MP bride tortured, branded with hot knife; over 50 burn marks found
content: In a shocking incident in Barwani district, a man branded his wife with a hot knife, accusing her of not being beautiful. Khushboo, the victim, reported the abuse to the police, revealing over 50 burn marks on her body. Her husband, Dilip Pipaliya, has been booked for causing hurt and cruelty.

title: Big Make-in-India push: PM Modi inaugurates EV plant in Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated Maruti Suzuki's first made-in-India Battery Electric Vehicle, the e-Vitara, in Gujarat, destined for export to over 100 countries. This launch, coinciding with the start of hybrid battery electrode production, signifies India's growing strength in green mobility.

title: ‘Caught on camera’: Video shows Israeli strike on Nasser Hospital; journalists among 20 killed
content: Israeli strikes on Gaza's Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis resulted in the deaths of at least 20 people, including five journalists. The initial strike hit the hospital's fourth floor, a common location for reporters, followed by a second explosion targeting medics and journalists assisting the wounded.

title: Vehicle falls into river ahead of Kiren Rijiju’s convoy in Ladakh; 2 men rescued
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju's convoy was near Drass in Ladakh when a vehicle plunged into a river, prompting a rescue of two individuals. Rijiju also lauded Sonmarg's hospitality and development in Jammu and Kashmir. Furthermore, he criticized Syeda Hameed's remarks on Bangladeshi immigrants, emphasizing concerns about illegal migration and the persecution of minorities in neighboring countries.

title: Anu Malik reacts to his relationship with nephews Amaal & Armaan; calls them his ‘jaan’
content: Anu Malik clarified his strong bond with brothers Daboo and Abu Malik, dismissing rumors of family tensions and emphasizing their enduring love. He acknowledged their 'Malik trait' of expressing affection through what others perceive as anger. Amaal Mallik previously revealed the brothers' professional rivalry, where Anu's competitive nature sometimes impacted Daboo's career, despite their close personal relationship.

title: Kerala temple row: Purification ritual at Guruvayoor; reels in pond trigger complaint
content: Guruvayur devaswom has ordered purification rituals at the temple after vlogger Jasmin Jaffar allegedly washed her feet in the temple pond and filmed reels, violating temple rules. The rituals, scheduled for Tuesday, will lead to restricted entry for devotees. Devaswom administrator filed a police complaint and will initially cover ritual expenses from devaswom funds, later pursuing legal action.

title: Mysuru lodge murder: Man kills lover with ‘controlled blast in her mouth’; face blown up
content: A 25-year-old man, Siddaraju, has been detained in Mysuru district for the murder of 20-year-old Darshitha in a lodge room. Police suspect Siddaraju, who knew Darshitha for seven years, killed her after she refused to marry him.

title: Nasa to launch TOMEX+ mission from Wallops Island
content: NASA is preparing to launch three sounding rockets from Wallops Island, Virginia, on August 26, 2025, as part of the TOMEX+ mission. Residents across the mid-Atlantic may witness colourful vapour trails. The mission will study the mesopause, a critical atmospheric layer influencing weather and satellite operations.

title: Himachal flood: Beas river washes away parts of Chandigarh highway; Manali-Leh road blocked
content: Heavy flooding of the Beas river has caused significant damage, washing away sections of the Chandigarh-Manali highway and impacting hotels and restaurants. Key routes like the Manali-Leh highway are blocked due to the river's force. With a red alert issued, educational institutions across several districts including Kullu and Mandi, remain closed as the region grapples with the aftermath.

title: 'Mocked over small house': Jaipur man wins divorce at 67; cited mental cruelty by wife
content: A Jaipur family court granted a 67-year-old man a divorce after 43 years of marriage, citing his wife's constant suspicion and character assassination as mental cruelty. The retired government officer filed for divorce in 2021, alleging taunts about their home and her accusations. The court found the wife's allegations unsubstantiated, leading to the divorce decree.

title: ‘Goondaism is their culture’: Annamalai accuses DMK of thuggery; alleges councillor assaulted resident
content: Tamil Nadu BJP president K Annamalai has strongly criticized the DMK, accusing them of fostering a culture of "goondagiri." He alleges that a DMK councillor and his associates assaulted a resident in Tiruvarur for objecting to a banner placement. Annamalai condemned the DMK's alleged thuggery and violence, directly tagging Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in his post.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,800; Sensex down over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, dropped in opening trade on Tuesday as US notified 50% tariffs on India effective tomorrow. While Nifty50 went below 24,800, BSE Sensex was down over 600 points.

title: ‘We count on India's contribution’: Zelenskyy thanks PM Modi for I-Day greetings
content: President Zelenskyy thanked Prime Minister Modi for his Independence Day wishes, expressing hope for India's role in ending the conflict through diplomacy. PM Modi reiterated India's commitment to peace and offered support for a peaceful resolution through dialogue. Both leaders emphasized strengthening bilateral ties, with Zelenskyy invited to visit India.

title: 'We are a peace-loving nation, but ... ': CDS Chauhan's strong message
content: General Anil Chauhan emphasized India's commitment to peace while asserting the necessity of military preparedness, stating that peace without power is unattainable. He highlighted the blurring lines between war and peace, the importance of population resilience, and the evolving metrics of victory in modern conflicts.

title: Who is Jim Murray? Eagles legend, humanitarian, & family man who left a lasting legacy at 87
content: Jim Murray, the former Philadelphia Eagles GM and Ronald McDonald House co-founder, passed away at 87. He transformed the Eagles into a Super Bowl contender and dedicated his life to aiding families in need. Murray's strategic leadership and compassionate spirit left an enduring legacy on both the NFL and the Philadelphia community, earning him numerous accolades.

title: At 45, legend Venus holds back tears, discusses future - Watch
content: Venus Williams faced an emotional first-round defeat at the US Open against Karolina Muchova, casting doubt on her future in tennis. Despite a strong showing after a 16-month break, Williams lost in three sets. She expressed gratitude for the wild card entry and highlighted her improved physical condition compared to their previous encounter, emphasising her joy in playing pain-free.

title: Kate Middleton debuts blonde hair at Balmoral: Looks well, ready to be seen
content: Princess Kate Middleton debuted a lighter, honey-blonde hair color during a recent appearance near Balmoral with Prince William and their children. The family attended Sunday service at Crathie Kirk, drawing attention to Kate's fresh, summery look.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are the rates headed on August 26 & the near-term
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised to increase as the US Federal Reserve considers rate cuts, influenced by Chairman Powell's focus on the job market. Geopolitical tensions, including US actions in Venezuela and Israeli strikes in Yemen, add to market uncertainty. Investors should monitor US tariff policies on India and upcoming economic data for further direction.

title: Inside Tommy Fleetwood’s net worth and love story with wife who once rejected him
content: Tommy Fleetwood, a top-earning golfer with over $31 million from the PGA Tour and $35 million from the DP World Tour, owes much of his success to his wife, Clare. Despite a 23-year age difference and initial hesitations about mixing business with romance, Clare became Fleetwood's manager and life partner.

title: Syko Stu’s brother speaks after Raja Jackson attack, issues scam alert
content: Independent wrestler Syko Stu was brutally attacked by Raja Jackson at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event, resulting in severe injuries and an LAPD investigation. Stu's brother, Andrew, has released a statement confirming Stu is in critical care and warning fans about fraudulent GoFundMe campaigns.

title: Cowboys’ Jerry Jones moves to block Micah Parsons trade
content: Despite a contract dispute and trade request from Micah Parsons, former NFL GM Doug Whaley believes the star pass rusher will remain with the Dallas Cowboys. Whaley points to past situations with Myles Garrett and T.J. Watt, where money ultimately resolved similar issues.

title: The last sortie: IAF chief flies MiG-21 into history
content: Ahead of their retirement after six decades of service, Air Chief Marshal A P Singh and other IAF officers flew MiG-21 sorties as a final farewell. ACM Singh praised the aircraft's agility but acknowledged its outdated technology and maintenance challenges. The formal farewell for the MiG-21s will be held in Chandigarh on Sept 26.

title: Mild drizzle in Hyderabad on August 26; light rain forecast for three days

title: Online Sports Bill impact: Dream11 CEO opens up - '95% of revenues disappeared..'
content: Dream11, facing a massive revenue hit after the passage of the Online Gaming Bill 2025, may discontinue its Indian cricket team title sponsorship despite a USD 44 million contract. CEO Harsh Jain confirmed a near-total revenue wipeout but assured no layoffs. The ban on real money gaming, while allowing social gaming, severely impacts Dream11's core business.

title: ED raids AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj, others in hospital construction 'scam'
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at AAP leader Saurabh Bhardwaj's residence and other locations concerning a money laundering investigation tied to an alleged hospital construction scam in Delhi. Bhardwaj, a former Delhi minister, is under scrutiny following an earlier case registered by the Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB). Simultaneous raids were carried out at 12 premises linked to the case.

title: Raghav Gupta: INSEAD-trained exec appointed as OpenAI’s head of education initiatives in India
content: Raghav Gupta has been appointed as the head of education initiatives for India and the Asia Pacific at OpenAI. He will spearhead programs integrating AI into classrooms and collaborate with institutions like IIT Madras. Gupta's role includes overseeing research on AI's cognitive impact on students, leveraging his extensive experience to transform learning in the region.

title: 'US not piggy bank or doormat': Trump fresh tariff threat for nations with digital taxes
content: US President Trump on Monday threatened trade measures against nations with digital taxes targeting American tech giants, deeming them discriminatory. He warned of tariffs and export restrictions on technology and chips if these policies persist. Dozens of countries impose digital services taxes, prompting debates over fair contributions from tech companies.

title: Pujara retires: Starc's wife makes a startling revelation - 'Last of a dying breed'
content: Alyssa Healy, captain of the Australian women's team and wife of Mitchell Starc, shared insights into the Australian men's cricket team's strategies against Cheteshwar Pujara, who recently retired. Pujara's remarkable defensive technique and endurance made him a formidable opponent, particularly in Australia, where he consistently wore down bowlers.

title: Fantasy baseball news: Guerrero ready to return; Semien might be done for 2025
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . the schedule begins at 6:35 p.m. ET with the Baltimore Orioles hosting the Boston Red Sox .

content: the league has entered its final flurry of trades before the start of the regular season . players who might be potential cut candidates or whose roster spots have been unexpectedly challenged during training camp are available . quarterback Sam Howell, running back Brian Robinson Jr., defensive tackle Harrison Phillips and wide receiver Skyy Moore are among the players who have changed teams for late-round picks .

content: eight teams advance to the 2025 WNBA playoffs, and the bracket is filling up . the regular season wraps up Sept. 11, and we're tracking which teams have secured a spot in the postseason, which opens Sept. 14 .

title: ED raids AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj: What is Delhi hospital construction 'scam'?
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.
